Due to the low numbers allowed, the high school has devised a plan for families of athletes and band members. Passes have been distributed and ONLY those individuals with a pass - one person per pass only - will be permitted into the venues. The District understands that members of the community support our athletic teams, however, we must abide by the current regulations put in place for the health and safety of all. The District asks that residents respect the plan put in place. The District will continue to update the spectator plan as the health situation changes within the county.

Student Project Highlights: Mr. Clark, Secondary English Teacher

"The English 12 kids created these 'Role on the Wall' assignments. We read the novel “The Things They Carried.” It is a story about the Vietnam War. This assignment asks the kids to make connections with the text by examining internal and external feelings.

Each student selects compelling quotes from the text and the feelings they represent, then depict them on the following slides. This is a popular assignment they look forward to. Usually, we do this with large poster board, Sharpies, and in groups of 5. However, due to the regulations (and the fact this was done before we had a handle on Google Meets) each student was tasked to do this on their own.

The results exceeded my expectations and will change they way the assignment is done in the future."

#DynamoProud

SHS Senior Matthew Stover, the Cadet Commander of the Civil Air Patrol Armstrong County Composite Squadron 125, had the opportunity to visit Washington, DC with the Civil Air Patrol February 25th - 28th 2020. During the visit, Matthew had the opportunity to meet with US Senator Pat Toomey (PA), along with Pennsylvania Wing Commander Col. Kevin Berry, Pennsylvania Wing Vice Commander Maj. Steven Aaron, and C/Lt Col. Gwen Stahl (Cadet Commander of the Jimmy Stewart Squadron 714 in Indiana County). While meeting with Senator Toomey, Matthew and the other Civil Air Patrol members, lobbied the Senator for funds that the Civil Air Patrol relies upon to fulfill its mission. Matthew also met with Representative John Joyce of Pennsylvania’s 13th Congressional district and US Senator Patrick Leahy from Vermont.

After meeting with Senators Toomey and Leahy, and Representative Joyce, Matthew was able to tour Joint Base Andrews. This visit included touring the Boeing C-32 Air Force 2, which is the plane that transports the Vice President.

Dynamos are doing amazing things...#DynamoProud

Acmetonia's 4th grade students participated in the finale of their Ecostudent Challenge. Students were tasked to study 100 facts about the ecosystem, and the challenges our planet faces. Next, they were to get sponsors to support their mission: to learn as many of the 100 facts for a 100 question test. Sponsors could support the student for as little as a penny a question to as much as they wanted to support.

The money raised goes to a non-profit organization called Cape Clasp. The group is affiliated with several other organizations that help save the marine life (turtles/ seals/ sharks/ whales) specifically in the Cape Cod area. This finale included a video conference presentation with the owner/ founder of the organization Cape Clasp. When the final donations were counted, students raised $3,759.27 for the organization. Way to go Dynamos!!

post_text: Congratulations to Acmetonia Primary School for being recognized in the best practices section of the Highmark High 5 newsletter for transition to Kindergarten practices. As part of the transition to kindergarten, Acme is involved with the Allegheny Intermediate Unit and the United Way in their Hi5! program. To be part of the program, the District turns in a Kindergarten transition plan and are then awarded a small grant. At the end of the school year, there is a Hi5! Celebration Roundtable where each Hi5! district showcases something they did as a transition activity during the school year. Last year, Ms. Regner and Ms. Redman showcased a preschool provider meeting that was held in the fall and focused on data from kindergarten screening. The teachers have also been asked to make a small presentation about this data meeting as it relates to “making intentional connections with early learning providers” at the Hi5! Fall Roundtable in November. #DynamoProud

The Allegheny Valley School District Food Service Department has positions available. If you desire a part-time or substitute position and can work Monday through Friday, approximately four to five hours per day, we would like to talk to you. Team players are needed to help keep our fast-paced school cafeterias performing smoothly and efficiently.

Job Description and Duties:
• Part-time work may include 20-25 hours per week
• Hours range from 7am – 2pm (most shifts range from
9am to 1:30pm)
• Four to five hour daily shifts
• Weekends, nights, holidays, and summer months off
(school calendar year)
• Cleaning, dishwashing, basic food preparation, meal
serving, and or computer point-of-sale cashiering
• No experience needed
• Free training and t-shirt uniform provided

Applications are available at all school offices, including the Administrative Center. Call 724-274-2105 for more details. Food Service Department information is also available on the District website at www.avsdweb.org

post_text: Today, the Allegheny Valley School District continued the annual celebration of its support staff. We thank all of our administrative assistants, cafeteria workers, custodians, health assistants, and maintenance workers who support our students every day. These men and woman daily make countless contributions that enhance our school district; their efforts tireless. Many times these individuals are the listeners, the ones who encourage, the smile-givers. They are the staff members who provide support in quiet and unobtrusive ways. They continue to remind us that everyone plays a vital role in creating the many opportunities offered at Allegheny Valley. We extend our thanks to all of these individuals who give of themselves and share their talents to continue to make the Allegheny Valley School District a special place. We feel so very lucky to have you here with us.
